Name: Africa
Description: Africa is the world's second-largest and second-most populous continent, known for its diverse wildlife and cultures. It hosts a large diversity of ethnicities, cultures, and languages.

Animals.Name: African Elephant
Animals.Description: The African elephant is the largest living terrestrial animal. They are known for their large ears, long trunks, and ivory tusks. They play an important role in maintaining the biodiversity of the ecosystems they inhabit.

Animals.Name: Lion
Animals.Description: The lion is one of the big cats. It is a member of the family Felidae.
Animals.ImagePrompt: Male lion resting on a rock

Animals.Name: Giraffe
Animals.Description: The giraffe is an African artiodactyl mammal, the tallest living terrestrial animal.
Animals.ImagePrompt: Tall giraffe in the African plains

Landmarks.Name: Mount Kilimanjaro
Landmarks.Description: Mount Kilimanjaro is a dormant volcano in Tanzania. It is the highest mountain in Africa.

Landmarks.Name: Victoria Falls
Landmarks.Description: Victoria Falls is a waterfall on the Zambezi River in southern Africa.

Landmarks.Name: Great Pyramids of Giza
Landmarks.Description: The Great Pyramid of Giza is the oldest and largest of the pyramids in the Giza complex.
Landmarks.ImagePrompt: The Great Pyramids of Giza in Egypt

QuizQuestions.Question: Which is the largest desert in Africa?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world.

QuizQuestions.Question: Which African country was never colonized by Europeans?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: Ethiopia is the only African country that was never colonized.

QuizQuestions.Question: What is the longest river in Africa?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: The Nile River is the longest river in Africa.

Name: Antarctica
Description: Antarctica is Earth's southernmost continent, containing the geographic South Pole. About 98% of Antarctica is covered by ice.

Animals.Name: Emperor Penguin
Animals.Description: The emperor penguin is the tallest and heaviest of all living penguin species.

Animals.Name: Weddell Seal
Animals.Description: The Weddell seal is a relatively large and abundant true seal.
Animals.ImagePrompt: Weddell seal resting on Antarctic ice

Landmarks.Name: Mount Erebus
Landmarks.Description: Mount Erebus is the second-highest volcano in Antarctica.

Landmarks.Name: Blood Falls
Landmarks.Description: Blood Falls is an outflow of iron-rich water from Taylor Glacier.
Landmarks.ImagePrompt: The red Blood Falls flowing from Taylor Glacier

QuizQuestions.Question: Which country claimed the first territorial claim in Antarctica?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: The United Kingdom was the first country to make a territorial claim.

QuizQuestions.Question: What treaty governs human activities in Antarctica?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: The Antarctic Treaty sets aside Antarctica as a scientific preserve.

Name: Asia
Description: Asia is Earth's largest and most populous continent. It was the site of many of the first civilizations.

Animals.Name: Giant Panda
Animals.Description: The giant panda is a bear native to South Central China.

Animals.Name: Bengal Tiger
Animals.Description: The Bengal tiger is a tiger native to the Indian subcontinent.
Animals.ImagePrompt: Bengal tiger walking through tall grass

Landmarks.Name: Great Wall of China
Landmarks.Description: The Great Wall of China is a series of fortifications.
Landmarks.ImagePrompt: The Great Wall of China winding along mountain ridges

Landmarks.Name: Taj Mahal
Landmarks.Description: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum in Agra, India.

QuizQuestions.Question: Which is the most populous country in Asia?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: China is the most populous country in Asia.

QuizQuestions.Question: Which mountain range contains Mount Everest?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: Mount Everest is located in the Himalayan mountain range.

Name: Australia
Description: Australia is a sovereign country comprising the mainland of the Australian continent. It is known for its Sydney Opera House.

Animals.Name: Kangaroo
Animals.Description: The kangaroo is a marsupial from the family Macropodidae.
Animals.ImagePrompt: Red kangaroo hopping across the outback

Animals.Name: Koala
Animals.Description: The koala is an arboreal herbivorous marsupial native to Australia.
Animals.ImagePrompt: Koala clinging to a eucalyptus tree branch

Landmarks.Name: Sydney Opera House
Landmarks.Description: The Sydney Opera House is a multi-venue performing arts centre.

Landmarks.Name: Great Barrier Reef
Landmarks.Description: The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system.
Landmarks.ImagePrompt: Aerial view of the Great Barrier Reef

QuizQuestions.Question: What is the capital city of Australia?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: Canberra is the capital city of Australia.

QuizQuestions.Question: Which of these animals is NOT native to Australia?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: Tigers are not native to Australia.

Name: Europe
Description: Europe is a continent located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere. It is known for its rich history, art, and diverse cultures.

Animals.Name: European Brown Bear
Animals.Description: The European brown bear is a subspecies of the brown bear native to much of Europe.
Animals.ImagePrompt: European brown bear in a forest

Animals.Name: Iberian Lynx
Animals.Description: The Iberian lynx is a wild cat species native to the Iberian Peninsula.

Landmarks.Name: Eiffel Tower
Landmarks.Description: The Eiffel Tower is a wrought-iron lattice tower in Paris, France.

Landmarks.Name: Colosseum
Landmarks.Description: The Colosseum is an oval amphitheatre in the centre of Rome, Italy.

QuizQuestions.Question: Which is the smallest country in Europe?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: Vatican City is the smallest country in Europe.

QuizQuestions.Question: Which European mountain range separates Europe from Asia?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: The Ural Mountains are the geographical boundary between Europe and Asia.

Name: North America
Description: North America is a continent within the Northern Hemisphere. It has diverse ecosystems and landscapes.

Animals.Name: American Bison
Animals.Description: The American bison is a North American species of bison.
Animals.ImagePrompt: American bison grazing on the Great Plains

Animals.Name: Bald Eagle
Animals.Description: The bald eagle is a bird of prey found in North America.
Animals.ImagePrompt: Bald eagle perched on a tree branch

Landmarks.Name: Grand Canyon
Landmarks.Description: The Grand Canyon is a steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River.
Landmarks.ImagePrompt: The vast Grand Canyon at sunset

Landmarks.Name: Statue of Liberty
Landmarks.Description: The Statue of Liberty is a colossal neoclassical sculpture in New York Harbor.
Landmarks.ImagePrompt: The Statue of Liberty in New York City

QuizQuestions.Question: Which is the largest country by area in North America?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: Canada is the largest country by area in North America.

QuizQuestions.Question: Which North American mountain range runs from Canada to New Mexico?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: The Rocky Mountains run from Canada to New Mexico.

Name: South America
Description: South America is a continent mostly in the Southern Hemisphere. It is known for the Amazon rainforest.

Animals.Name: Jaguar
Animals.Description: The jaguar is a large felid species native to the Americas.
Animals.ImagePrompt: Jaguar lurking in the Amazon rainforest

Animals.Name: Andean Condor
Animals.Description: The Andean condor is a South American bird in the New World vulture family.
Animals.ImagePrompt: Andean condor soaring above the Andes Mountains

Landmarks.Name: Machu Picchu
Landmarks.Description: Machu Picchu is a 15th-century Inca citadel in Peru.
Landmarks.ImagePrompt: The ancient Inca city of Machu Picchu

Landmarks.Name: Amazon Rainforest
Landmarks.Description: The Amazon rainforest is a moist broadleaf tropical rainforest.
Landmarks.ImagePrompt: Aerial view of the Amazon rainforest

QuizQuestions.Question: Which is the largest country by area in South America?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: Brazil is the largest country by area in South America.

QuizQuestions.Question: Which mountain range runs along the western coast of South America?
QuizQuestions.Explanation: The Andes mountain range runs along the western coast of South America.
